pr_title: [FLINK-16013][core] Make complex type config options could be parsed correctly

timeline.message:
[FLINK-16013][core] Write and parse list config option correctly

When the configuration value is List type, we need to convert it to a semicolon-separated string in Configuration#toMap. And if we want to write the configuration to a yaml file, Configuration#toMap should be used to get all the keys and values.

[FLINK-16013][core] Make list and map config options could be parsed correctly

When the configuration value is List type, we need to convert it to a semicolon-separated string. For Map type config option, we need to convert it to comma-separated key:value pairs. And if we want to write the configuration to a yaml file, Configuration#toMap should be used to get all the keys and values.

[FLINK-16013][core] Make list and map config options could be parsed correctly

When the configuration value is List type, we need to convert it to a semicolon-separated string. For Map type config option, we need to convert it to comma-separated key:value pairs. And if we want to write the configuration to a yaml file, Configuration#toMap should be used to get all the keys and values.

[FLINK-16013][core] Make complex type config options could be parsed correctly

If the config option value is complex type(e.g. Duration, List, Map), it need to be properly handled when converting to string. For List type, we need to convert it to a semicolon-separated string. For Map type, we need to convert it to comma-separated key:value pairs. For Duration type, we need to convert it to a nano seconds string. And if we want to write the configuration to a yaml file, Configuration#toMap should be used to get all the keys and values.

timeline.author: dawidwys

replies.bodyText:
Could you also escape the entries in the list? Parsing lists supports escaping with ' character.
So that e.g. A;'A;B';C is parsed as ["A", "A;B", "C"]. The same applies for Maps. I think when writing values out it's safe to always escape them.
You can check some examples of escaping in StructuredOptionsSplitterTest or in ReadableWritableConfigurationTest see test for list<string>.
replies.author: dawidwys
zentol

replies.bodyText: I will escape the value string when converting List and Map to structured string. Also Collectors.joining(";") will make the codes more concise.
replies.author: wangyang0918

timeline.bodyText: How about we combine those tests into a single one. Tests that do IO operations might be expensive.
timeline.author: dawidwys

replies.bodyText: But on the other hand I do appreciate testing a single thing at a time. I think the classes are not very testable, especially the GlobalConfiguration.
replies.author: dawidwys

replies.bodyText: I will merge this tests to a single one.
replies.author: wangyang0918

timeline.message:
[FLINK-16013][core] Make complex type config options could be parsed correctly

If the config option value is complex type(e.g. Duration, List, Map), it need to be properly handled when converting to string. For List type, we need to convert it to a semicolon-separated string. For Map type, we need to convert it to comma-separated key:value pairs. For Duration type, we need to convert it to a nano seconds string. And if we want to write the configuration to a yaml file, Configuration#toMap should be used to get all the keys and values.

timeline.bodyText:
I don't necessarily understand why do we need that complex logic.
Can't we just do "'" + value.replaceAll("'", "''") + "'" ?
Moreover we should try not to use any external dependencies. Especially guava.
timeline.author: dawidwys
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -52,6 +59,37 @@ return processTokens(tokens); } + /** + * When write a string out, it is always needs to escaped. If the input string contains double quote or specified + * escape chars, then it will be escaped by single quote. The single quote will be escaped by doubling. + * + *

Given that the escapeChar is (;) + * + *

Examples: + *

    + *
  • A,B,C,D => A,B,C,D
    • + *
  • A;BCD => 'A;BCD'
    • + *
  • AB"C"D => 'AB"C"D'
    • + *
  • AB'"D:B => 'AB''"D:B'
    • + *
+ * + * @param value a string which needs to be escaped + * @param escapeChars escape chars for the escape conditions + * @return escaped string with single quote + */ + static String escapeWithSingleQuote(String value, String... escapeChars) {

replies.author: dawidwys

replies.bodyText: Usually the guava implementation has better performance than java regex replacement. However, i am not against with removing the guava dependencies. I will use "'" + value.replaceAll("'", "''") + "'" instead.
replies.author: wangyang0918

replies.bodyText: The escape condition also needs to add string.contains("'").
replies.author: wangyang0918

timeline.author: dawidwys

replies.bodyText: Make sense. I will update it.
replies.author: wangyang0918

timeline.message:
[FLINK-16013][core] Make complex type config options could be parsed correctly

If the config option value is complex type(e.g. Duration, List, Map), it need to be properly handled when converting to string. For List type, we need to convert it to a semicolon-separated string. For Map type, we need to convert it to comma-separated key:value pairs. For Duration type, we need to convert it to a nano seconds string. And if we want to write the configuration to a yaml file, Configuration#toMap should be used to get all the keys and values.

timeline.bodyText: nit: the contract of assertThat is that the first argument is the actual result. Therefore the arguments should swapped.
timeline.author: dawidwys

replies.bodyText: I will have quick fix and push again.
replies.author: wangyang0918
